column4: right click on the gnome panel, add applet, add the network one
what is the gnome panel? (sorry to be such a newbie)
the thing at the top with the clock, find a blank area and right click on it
nowhere, in general
so how can I find out how much disk space I have used and have available?
'df -h' will show both values for each mounted partition
cp -a, or tar, or rsync
thanks. I went with cp -a and it's working great!
it's unkillable then
the unkillable process is a disk read. Now I can't access the disk... The disk is damaged, BTW....
yeah, then you're screwed
the kernel ca't beat bad hardware
I'm just surprised it doesn't at some point give up and just report a read error...
it might eventually
it's been easily 15 min... This is a bummer. 70gig of ntfs crap. Most of it is readable...and then this happens when I try to copy it to a clean disk...
eep
it just came back! So...is there a way to reduce the number of read retries before reporting back failure?
hm, I don't know, sorry
any way you could help me troubleshoot a samba network printing problem?
it's 0145, sorry
okay. Yep. Get some sleep. Thanks for responding.
